Diagnosis : Male: expanse 21–23 mm , wing length 11–13 mm ; fore wings dark reddish-brown with narrow yellowish concave medial fasciae; cilia with whitish and reddish-brown spots; discal spot sometimes visible as a vague darker point; hind wings monotonous dark reddish-brown with unicoloured dark cilia; genitalia similar to those of nominate subspecies. Female: expanse 24–28 mm , wing length 14–16 mm ; fore wings light rosy-cream with yellowish fields, basal part yellowish, medial field slightly rosy darkened; discal always distinct in spite is tender pointed out; both medial fasciae developed, curved, darker than the ground colour; cilia with yellowish and reddish-brown spotsl hind wings cream-rosy, often with whitish transversal band; cilia whitish distally and creamy-rosy proximally; genitalia similar to those of nominate subspecies. The new subspecies differs from the nominate one by darker coloration (brighter reddish-brown in ssp.
parallela
) and smaller size (in ssp.
parallela
, expanse 24–26 mm in males and 30–33 mm in females, with wing length 13– 14 mm in males and 17–18 in females), especially in females.

MAP 14 .
Malacosoma parallela iranica Zolotuhin & Zahiri, 2007
(circles) and
Malacosoma parallela parallela Staudinger, 1887
(squares).

Bionomics . The biology of this smaller and darker coloured subspecies is unknown. It occurs from 130–3000 m , mostly above 1600–1800 m , and is on the wing from May to late July depending on altitude. Supposedly food plants and biology would be similar to those of ssp.
parallela
:
Amygdalus , Malus , Prunus , Pyrus , Cerasus , Rosa , Sorbus , Crataegus , Cydonia, Chaemomeles, Padus, Ribes , Hippophae , Berberis, Juglans , Populus , Salix , Quercus , Atraphaxis , Myricaria, Fraxinus, Lonicera, Vitis
. Barou ( 1967 ), Rajabi ( 1986 ), and Modarres Awal ( 1994 & 1997 ) list for the Iranian subspecies apple (
Malus
sp.), pear, quince (
Cydonia oblonga
: Rosaceae ), plum, apricot,
Cerasus
, white-thorn, maple (
Acer
sp.), buckthorn (
Rhamnus
sp.: Rhamnaceae ), willow (
Salix
sp.), alder (
Alnus
sp.: Betulaceae ), horn beam (
Carpinus betulus
: Betulaceae ), birch, beech (
Fagus orientalis
: Fagaceae ), poplar (
Populus
sp.), oak (
Quercus
sp.), roses (
Rosa
sp.), sloe-tree (
Prunus spinosa
: Rosaceae ), barberry (
Berberis vulgaris
: Berberidaceae ),
Hippophae rhamnoides
L.;
Betula pendula Roth.
;
Carpinus
sp.;
Sorbus
. Eggs hibernate. Caterpillars live in common web.
